item.title: Mentioned by StarPhoenix
item.description:

item.title: Mentioned by Montreal Gazette
item.description:
L. Ian MacDonald: Mixed report on Mulcair
Following Layton's death in August 2011, and the weak interim leadership of Nycole Turmel in the House, the NDP decided it needed an experienced parliamentarian. With 13 years in the Quebec legislature, and five more in the House of ... It's costing him votes in Ontario and English-speaking ridings in Quebec, and has cost him an MP who crossed to the Bloc Québécois because Mulcair implied Ottawa would have a role in shaping the question. “The side that wins, wins,” Mulcair said. But he lost in bringing it up.
